1.title: Mixed
1.plot: On the premiere episode, let us review some of the stand out designers in this year's Spring Summer collection, showcasing the highlights in the runways of Russia, Buenos Aires, Beijing, Amsterdam, Russia and Australia and how their designers measure up with the luxury labels such as Dior, Saint Laurent and Prada. Let's find out what the stars are wearing during the Met Ball and the Academy Awards with spotlights on Jennifer Lawrence, Michelle Williams, Emily Blunt, Daniel Radcliff and Charlize Theron. Designers featured: Krommenacker, Visentini, Ne Tiger, Winde ...

3.title: French Fashion
3.plot: Let's check if the French designers really do hold the cards when it comes to style. Will the Parisians keep it's footing in innovation and craftsmanship or will there be a chance for the Lebanese label Elie Saab to give them a run? Paul Gaultier is in his element but will he still have an upper hand when the Italian brands Fendi and Prada join the table? Who went French on the red carpet? Find out on Kiri's Celebrity Red Carpet as the stars in the Met Ball went olalah with Givenchy. Who wore the label with pride and who wore a questionable number that might cause ...

4.title: British Designers
4.plot: How did the Brits fair when it comes to style? Does the UK simply rule the school with cool? Or will the French and Italian steal the show from the Brits with a fierce competition in the runways. Are the British the best tailors in the world? Let's see if Stella McCartney can cling to her title. Can Westwood outshine Missoni? We do see a lot of celebs wearing the British designers on the red carpet with Cameron Diaz and Kirsten Stewart on Stella MCcartney, Christina Ricci and Helena Bonham Carter in Westwood creations. How about the punk headdress worn by Sarah ...

5.title: USA
5.plot: With the American designers leading the way in luxury design and technique, are they still considered the "new kids on the block" next to Europe? Is Michael Kors a Design Genius? Will he be unaffected with the re-branding of Italian designer Salvatore Ferragamo? Let's see how the Americans fair with their European counterparts. Celebrity correspondent, Kiri Bloore, finds herself spoiled with the span and choice of A-listers spotted on the Front Rows in New York. She also brings in the celebrities wearing US designers on the Red Carpet with Miley Cyrus rockin' out the ...

6.title: Asia
6.plot: Prints, Beading Embroidery dominates the Asian designers collection this season with bright animal prints by Kenzo, fantastic sculptural shapes by Lui Fang, and the intricate beading and embroidery by Manish Arora. Do the designers of the Far East have the talent and power to lure luxury brand fans from the West? Will they be able to outshine Britt Jenny Packham or the brightly colored designs of Diane von Furstenberg? Spotted on the Front Row of these events are Brook Shields on the Son Jung Wan fashion show, Patrick Wilson, and Nick Sullivan on the Kenzo show. The ...

imdb.plot outline: Ever dreamed of sitting in the front row at a fashion show? Wearing big shades and a designer coat? How about standing in some Jimmy Choo's on a Red Carpet with a horizon of flashing lights taking your picture and calling your name? Front Row gives you a VIP pass to the most wanted status-update and check in' hot spot in town: Fashion Week!
imdb.title: Front Row
plot: Ever dreamed of sitting in the front row at a fashion show? Wearing big shades and a designer coat? How about standing in some Jimmy Choo's on a Red Carpet with a horizon of flashing lights taking your picture and calling your name? _Front Row_ (qv) gives you a VIP pass to the most wanted status-update and check in' hot spot in town: Fashion Week!::Bigfoot Entertainment
